actor_awards.notes: Born Harold J. Smith, he was a Mohawk actor and athlete best known for his role as Tonto in 'The Lone Ranger' television series and films. He was the first Native American to play a Native American character in a major television series. He founded the Indian Actors Workshop in 1966 to help Native American actors find work in Hollywood. He was inducted into the Hall of Great Western Performers in 1993.

filmography.title: The Lone Ranger
filmography.role_description: The faithful Native American companion to the Lone Ranger who fights for justice in the Old West.
filmography.plot: The Lone Ranger and Tonto investigate the stirring of hostilities between local ranchers and a tribe of Indians, discovering a wealthy rancher is behind the conflict to hide a silver discovery.

filmography.title: The Lone Ranger and the Lost City of Gold
filmography.role_description: The Lone Ranger's loyal friend who helps protect a secret city of gold.
filmography.plot: The Lone Ranger and Tonto must stop a band of hooded riders from murdering the Indians who hold the medallions necessary to find a secret city of gold.

filmography.title: Key Largo
filmography.role_description: One of two fugitive Native American brothers seeking shelter at the hotel during a hurricane.
filmography.plot: A man visits his war buddy's family hotel and finds a gangster running things. As a hurricane approaches, the two end up confronting each other.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress (Claire Trevor)

filmography.title: Broken Arrow
filmography.role_description: The Apache leader who opposes peace with the white settlers.
filmography.plot: Tom Jeffords tries to make peace between settlers and Apaches. He becomes friends with Cochise, but their efforts are threatened by renegade factions.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Film Promoting International Understanding

filmography.title: The Battle at Apache Pass
filmography.role_description: The Apache warrior who incites war against the white soldiers despite Cochise's attempts at peace.
filmography.plot: Cochise and an army major try to maintain peace, but a corrupt Indian agent and Geronimo conspire to start a war.

filmography.title: Walk the Proud Land
filmography.role_description: The Apache leader who is eventually captured by Indian agent John Clum.
filmography.plot: Indian agent John Clum tries to bring a peaceful resolution to the conflicts with the Apaches and capture Geronimo without bloodshed.

filmography.title: Brave Warrior
filmography.role_description: The Shawnee chief who allies with the British during the War of 1812.
filmography.plot: Set during the War of 1812, the film depicts the conflict between the U.S. and Native American tribes allied with the British.

filmography.title: The Story of Will Rogers
filmography.role_description: A Cherokee friend of Will Rogers.
filmography.plot: A biography of the humorist Will Rogers, from his early days in Oklahoma to his death in an airplane crash.

filmography.title: Indian Paint
filmography.role_description: The chief of the Arikara tribe and father of the young protagonist.
filmography.plot: A young Native American boy tames a painted pony and prepares to become a warrior.

filmography.title: The Black Dakotas
filmography.role_description: A Sioux war chief who threatens to break the peace treaty.
filmography.plot: During the Civil War, Confederate agents try to incite the Sioux into a war against the Union to draw troops away from the front.

filmography.title: Drums Across the River
filmography.role_description: The son of the Ute chief who fights against gold-seekers encroaching on their land.
filmography.plot: A man tries to open up Ute territory for gold mining, inciting a war between the tribe and the settlers.

filmography.title: War Arrow
filmography.role_description: A Kiowa chief who is in conflict with the US Cavalry and Seminole scouts.
filmography.plot: A cavalry major arrives at a fort with orders to crush a Kiowa uprising by enlisting the help of peaceful Seminole Indians.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Film Promoting International Understanding (Jeff Chandler)

filmography.title: Saskatchewan
filmography.role_description: A Cree scout and blood brother to the Mountie protagonist.
filmography.plot: A Canadian Mountie tries to prevent the Sioux from forcing the Cree into a war against the British crown.

filmography.title: Masterson of Kansas
filmography.role_description: A peace-seeking Indian chief who negotiates with Bat Masterson.
filmography.plot: Bat Masterson, Wyatt Earp, and Doc Holliday join forces to stop a range war and clear a man falsely accused of murder.

filmography.title: Yankee Buccaneer
filmography.role_description: A warrior encountered by the disguised naval crew.
filmography.plot: A U.S. Navy commander and his crew go undercover as pirates to track down a fleet of privateers in the Caribbean.

filmography.title: Red Mountain
filmography.role_description: An Indian who aids the Confederate General Quantrill.
filmography.plot: A Confederate captain goes to Colorado to join General Quantrill, who is stirring up rebellion in the West.

filmography.title: Captain from Castile
filmography.role_description: An Aztec prince who encounters the Spanish conquistadors.
filmography.plot: A young Spanish officer flees the Inquisition and joins Cortez's expedition to the New World.

filmography.title: Yellow Sky
filmography.role_description: An uncredited role as an Indian.
filmography.plot: A band of bank robbers on the run from the law take refuge in a ghost town, only to find an old man and his granddaughter prospecting for gold.
filmography.awards: Writers Guild Award: Win – Best Written American Western

filmography.title: Lust for Gold
filmography.role_description: A deputy sheriff investigating murders near the Lost Dutchman's Mine.
filmography.plot: A man searches for a lost gold mine in Arizona, uncovering a history of greed and murder.

filmography.title: Alias Jesse James
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance as Tonto, appearing alongside other western legends.
filmography.plot: An inept insurance salesman sells a life insurance policy to the notorious outlaw Jesse James.

filmography.title: The Phynx
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance as Tonto in this musical comedy.
filmography.plot: An athlete, a campus militant, a black model, and an American Indian are picked by a computer to form a rock group called the Phynx and go on tour in Albania to rescue hostages.

filmography.title: One Little Indian
filmography.role_description: A Native American character in this Disney western.
filmography.plot: A cavalry soldier on the run meets a boy raised by Indians and together they try to evade capture while riding a camel.

filmography.title: Santee
filmography.role_description: A ranch foreman and friend to the bounty hunter Santee.
filmography.plot: A bounty hunter adopts the son of an outlaw he killed, but the boy wants revenge.

filmography.title: Smith!
filmography.role_description: A Native American character involved in a legal dispute.
filmography.plot: A farmer defies the law and shelters a Native American friend accused of murder.

filmography.title: The Man Who Loved Cat Dancing
filmography.role_description: A Native American chief in this western romance.
filmography.plot: A woman leaves her abusive husband and gets mixed up with a gang of outlaws who have robbed a train.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Sarah Miles)

filmography.title: Return to Warbow
filmography.role_description: A character in this western about an escaped convict.
filmography.plot: Three convicts escape prison and return to the town of Warbow to retrieve stolen money.

filmography.title: The Vanishing American
filmography.role_description: A Navajo leader fighting for his people's rights.
filmography.plot: A Navajo man fights against corrupt whites who are trying to take Indian lands.

filmography.title: Four Guns to the Border
filmography.role_description: An Apache member of a gang of bank robbers.
filmography.plot: A gang of bank robbers encounters a former gunslinger and his daughter, leading to a conflict with Apaches.

filmography.title: The Nebraskan
filmography.role_description: A Sioux warrior involved in a conflict with the US Army.
filmography.plot: A scout tries to prevent an Indian war after a soldier kills a Sioux chief.

filmography.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
filmography.role_description: The famous Sioux chief Red Cloud.
filmography.plot: A Southerner joins the Union Army during the Civil War but is accused of treason.

filmography.title: The Pathfinder
filmography.role_description: The loyal Mohican friend of the Pathfinder.
filmography.plot: A white man raised by Mohican Indians helps the British army uncover a French spy.
